that fashion exactly, making it basically fiction, with a basis in reality, 
but once you tamper with that you tread into bullshit.

others, it makes them a work of fiction.

comments.text:

comments.author: Keety Mang

comments.text:
Investment. Release one monster to kill the others. His release meant the 
take-down of his entire company's head honchos: the engine in the 
bulldozer. If they had just arrested Belfort then someone else would have 
taken over, rewired the corporate machine to keep doing their current evil 
practices, but through loopholes and legal red tape to make it legal to 
keep robbing people. They would have learned from belfort's arrest and 
become more clandestine. Belfort was a piece of shit! However, his arrest 
ensured the FBI could learn of his dealings not only from the evidence, but 
from the man himself. He would be open to telling them every single little 
detail in person, and in honesty. Honesty because if he didn't and the 
tiniest inconsistency got out he would be on the cold end f a set of steel 
bars. This would pave the way for investigative departments to be more 
aware of others carrying out the same shady dealings and what to look out 
for. Nowadays, the FBI and the CIA are more inclined to monitor sharp 
spikes in share price, notice frequent dealings with parties in 
Switzerland, sudden takeoff of small companies with no new offerings into 
the marketplace, etc.
comments.author: Arliss Caruso

comments.author: Callum Thomas

comments.text:
People seem quick to associate the acts Belfort did to his disposition but 
not at all to his situation. Have you people heard of Stanley Milgram's 
experiment? Most people who went through that experiment didn't think they 
would go over 200-250v of shock yet the majority of them went to the max 
voltage. Research it. It's easy for some people to think that they would 
never do something terrible like this but unless you're in that situation 
yourself you have absolutely no idea how you would act. We're not all as 
great as we like to think we are. Have a little humility.﻿
comments.author: chopstix906

comments.text:
+chopstix906 The Milgram experiment was about people responding to orders 
from authoritative figures (i.e. scientists/doctors in that case). That has 
very little to do with this movie's subject matter of pure capitalistic 
greed and gluttony.

mind he is a freaking Master of the Universe but the harsh reality is he is

the film - it was all an illusion, like Matt McC's character tells him 
right at the very beginning of his time on Wall Street
